definition: to expose/to reveal/to lay bare/also pr. [pu4 lu4]
dew/syrup/nectar/outdoors (not under cover)/to show/to reveal/to betray/to expose
to lay bare/to come to light

sentences.english: A separate inlet with a ceramic frit is used to aerate the perfusate.
sentences.chinese: 用玻璃料製成的一個獨立進口暴露在灌流液中。

sentences.english: Irritative symptoms lessened with repeated exposures .
sentences.chinese: 刺激症狀隨着重複暴露而減輕。

sentences.english: You know college kids and their drunken exhibitionism.
sentences.chinese: 你知道，大學生和他們的酒後暴露。

sentences.english: His wild ambition was thoroughly exposed.
sentences.chinese: 他的狼子野心暴露無遺。

sentences.english: Health-damaging exposure to environmental risks can begin before birth.
sentences.chinese: 對環境危險有損於健康的暴露可在出生之前開始。

sentences.english: Also reveal an a few problems at the same time. 1 .
sentences.chinese: 同時也暴露出一些問題。

sentences.english: Volunteers were in the bush all the time and didn't let on.
sentences.chinese: 志願軍戰士們一直在灌木叢中，沒有暴露目標。

sentences.english: However Cuzco inserted mercilessly and the uterine ostium is exposed.
sentences.chinese: 然而無情和庫斯科插入子宮口暴露。

sentences.english: This exposes your administrative password to anyone looking over your shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 這會向任何窺探您左右的人暴露您的管理密碼。

sentences.english: I didn`t reveal anything that I should have kept to myself.
sentences.chinese: 我沒有暴露出任何我應該守口如瓶的祕密。

sentences.english: However this year the police have vowed to arrest them for indecent exposure.
sentences.chinese: 然而，今年警方宣誓以不恰當暴露罪逮捕他們。

sentences.english: Don't give away your positions until you see the mammoth. He's the one to surprise.
sentences.chinese: 沒見到毛象之前別暴露你們自己，我們得出其不意。

sentences.english: You will get sunburnt if you expose your skin to the sun too long.
sentences.chinese: 如果你將皮膚暴露在太陽底下太久，會被曬傷的。

sentences.english: Set up a local comprehensive HIV/AIDS occupational post-exposure emergency network.
sentences.chinese: 建立綜合性地方艾滋病職業暴露後應急處理網絡。

sentences.english: This situation has exposed the ancient poetry, teaching high school language problems.
sentences.chinese: 這種情況暴露了高中語文古代詩詞教學中存在的問題。

sentences.english: Does immunologic memory require chronic exposure to antigens?
sentences.chinese: 免疫反應之記憶性需要長期暴露於抗原嗎？

definition: to lay bare/to come to light
to hide/to conceal/to mask/to shelter/to harbor (i.e. keep sth hidden)/to hide oneself/to lie low/to nestle/hidden/implicit/private/covert/recessed (lighting)
to conceal/to hide behind/to cover up
to cover/to mask/to cover up or conceal (the truth etc)
to cover up/to conceal/to mask/to gloss over
to puncture/to lay bear or expose (lies etc)
hidden beneath the surface/buried and concealed
to present clearly/to give prominence to/to magnify/clear and obvious
